# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, col_name="dt")
    new_col = DataFrame(ym=map(yearmonth, df[col_name])), :nrow => size(df, 1))
    merge(df, new_col, on=:ym)
end

# Example usage
df = DataFrame(dt=[Date(2021, 1, 1)), Date(2022, 3, 15)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame `df` and a column name `col_name` (default is "dt") as input. It creates a new column `ym` by extracting the year and month from the specified date column and concatenating them in the format "yyyymm". The updated DataFrame with the new column is returned.
